senses.de: To tell someone about a possible danger or problem
senses.ex: The police have warned the public to stay indoors due to the storm.

Tips.title: Urgency
Tips.description: Used to express immediate attention or prompt action to avoid problems.
Tips.example: They warned us of the urgency to evacuate before the hurricane hit.

Tips.title: Strong Advice
Tips.description: When 'warn' is used, the advice given is stronger than a simple suggestion.
Tips.example: I must warn you, this route is far more dangerous at night.

Tips.title: Public Safety
Tips.description: Commonly used in contexts like weather news or law enforcement for public safety.
Tips.example: Meteorologists warned of a severe thunderstorm approaching the coast.

senses.de: To tell someone to behave properly
senses.ex: The teacher warned the students not to cheat during the test.

Tips.title: Behavior Correction
Tips.description: Indicates a need for someone to change their behavior to avoid consequences.
Tips.example: She was warned to stop texting during the meeting or face penalties.

Tips.title: Authority Figure
Tips.description: Often delivered by someone in a position of authority, like a teacher or boss.
Tips.example: The coach warned the player about showing up late to practice.

Tips.title: Future Consequences
Tips.description: Implies negative outcomes in the future if the warning is ignored.
Tips.example: The manager warned that continued tardiness would result in dismissal.

Advise.wordDefinition:
Advise means to suggest or give guidance on a course of action.

It is generally used in a positive sense, to give advice on how to proceed in a certain situation, for example, "I advise you to study hard for your exams."

Advise is used to give positive guidance or suggestion, while warn is used to caution against potential negative outcomes.

Alert.wordDefinition:
Alert is used to inform someone about a possible danger or problem, so that they can be prepared or take action to avoid it.

For example, a weather alert warns people about a storm approaching, so they can stay indoors and take necessary precautions.

An alert is letting someone know of a potential danger that is imminent or approaching, while a warning is informing someone of a danger that is already present or likely to happen in the near future.

Apprise.wordDefinition:
Apprise means to inform or notify someone about something important, while the word warn means to alert someone about a potential danger or harm.

For example, if you are going to be late for your friend's party, you would apprise them of the situation by letting them know via phone or text.

Apprise is used to provide information, while warn is used to indicate possible danger.

Caution.wordDefinition:
Caution means to advise someone to be careful or take care to avoid danger or risks, but it does not always mean there is an immediate threat.

For example, "Caution: Wet Floor" sign advises people to be careful when walking, but it may not cause an immediate or serious danger.

Caution advises someone to be careful and take care in potentially hazardous situations, while warn gives a specific notice of a clear and present danger to prevent harm to people, property or assets.

Forewarn.wordDefinition:
Forewarn means to give advance notice or warning about something that is going to happen in the future. For example, you may forewarn your friend that you're going to have a party at your house next weekend so that they can plan accordingly.

The main difference between warn and forewarn is that warn is used for informing about immediate danger while forewarn is used for informing about something that may happen in the future.

Inform.wordDefinition:
Inform means to give someone information or facts about something.

For example, if you tell your friend about a new restaurant that just opened up, you are informing them. If you warn them about the bad reviews the restaurant has been getting, you are alerting them to a potential negative experience.

Notify.wordDefinition:
Notify means to inform someone about something, often in a formal or official manner. For example, if you notify your teacher about an upcoming absence, you are letting them know in advance.

You notify someone to inform them about something, while you warn them to alert them to a potential danger.

Signal.wordDefinition:
Signal refers to a message or sign that indicates something is about to happen or is happening. For example, a traffic light signal tells drivers when to stop, go, or slow down.

In summary, signals give instructions or information while warnings alert people to possible dangers.

quotes.Text: People are afraid of trying something new, of failing even before they start. My point is, what is the worst that can happen? You will fail and friends who warned you will say 'I told you so!' So you made a mistake - and will hopefully make many more. But hey! The real tragedy is not the mistake you make, but not learning from it.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Suhasini Mulay

quotes.Text: If he didn't fall in love he would have never come back near the end of the film. Because, what man is going to dishonor himself so that he comes back in front of the man that took a woman away from him... and warns her to save her life?
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Rod Steiger

quotes.Text: Absolutely, it's a really weird stage because at the minute, I can walk down the street and be unrecognised, lead a normal life, but my label and everybody is warning me that will be changing and I'm in for a rollercoaster ride.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: James Blunt

quotes.Text: People in the CIA, they marry each other. They're like actors! We have to travel without much warning to far-flung places, and it's very hard to communicate what our experiences are like to those in the outside world.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Claire Danes

quotes.Text: Thing is, I don't really like free time. People are always warning me that I'm going to burn out. But the truth is, the only thing that tires me out is hearing people tell me that.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Michael Strahan

quotes.Text: Some people in the industry warned me that I'd ruin my career, miss out on possible jobs, and potentially put my life in danger if I ever came out.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Alyson Stoner

quotes.Text: When I decided to be a singer, my mother warned me I'd be alone a lot. Basically we all are. Loneliness comes with life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Whitney Houston

quotes.Text: Nobody warned me that when you fall in love, you really fall in love forever.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Junot Diaz

quotes.Text: Remember that life's big changes rarely give advance warning.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quotes.Text: My one purpose in life is to serve as a warning to others.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Jamie Zawinski
